description: The Sazerac is a family of cocktails that combine&nbsp;rye whiskey, sugar cube soaked in bitters (or simple syrup), water and cognac. This recipe, however, combines equal parts of cognac and rye for just the right depth and strength.
name: Sazerac

recipeInstructions.name: Fill an old-fashioned glass halfway with ice to chill it. Leave it be while you finish preparing the drink.
recipeInstructions.text: Fill an old-fashioned glass halfway with ice to chill it. Leave it be while you finish preparing the drink.

recipeInstructions.name: Place the sugar cube in a mixing glass, then add the bitters. With a wooden spoon, muddle the sugar cube until most of it is dissolved.
recipeInstructions.text: Place the sugar cube in a mixing glass, then add the bitters. With a wooden spoon, muddle the sugar cube until most of it is dissolved.

recipeInstructions.name: Pour the rye whiskey, cognac, and absinthe. Add some ice.
recipeInstructions.text: Pour the rye whiskey, cognac, and absinthe. Add some ice.

recipeInstructions.name: Stir well, then strain it into the chilled glass.
recipeInstructions.text: Stir well, then strain it into the chilled glass.

recipeInstructions.name: Garnish with the lemon twist. Serve and enjoy.
